Name: Uniformity
Annotation: Peak uniformity (p > 0.99 in KS test)

Name: Noisy Waveform
Annotation: If the waveform is noise, which means it is probabily a bad waveform

Name: Double Peak
Annotation: If there is double peak (max_combo_peaks > 1)

Name: Fail
Annotation: If there is a missing key point (starting point, down point etc.)

Name: σ(Amplitude)
Annotation: The standard deviation of amplitudes

Name: σ(Intensity)
Annotation: The standard deviation of intensity

Name: σ(Peak Space)
Annotation: The standard deviation of period

Name: σ(Inner Peak Space)
Annotation: The standard deviation of period removing outliers

Name: σ(Shoulder Position)
Annotation: The standard deviation of shoulder position

Name: σ(Shoulder/Tail)
Annotation: The standard deviation of shoulder tail ratio

Name: σ(PW10)
Annotation: Standard deviation of the peak widths at 10% of prominence

Name: σ(PW25)
Annotation: Standard deviation of the peak widths at 25% of prominence

Name: σ(PW50)
Annotation: Standard deviation of the peak widths at 50% of prominence

Name: σ(PW80)
Annotation: Standard deviation of the peak widths at 80% of prominence

Name: σ(PW90)
Annotation: Standard deviation of the peak widths at 90% of prominence

Name: σ(Tail Duration)
Annotation: Standard deviation of Tail Duration

Name: σ(Shoulder Amplitude)
Annotation: The standard deviation of amplitude of shoulder

Name: Average Rise/Decay
Annotation: Average rise time/decay time ratio

Name: Average Tail Proportion
Annotation: The average proportion of tail in one period

Name: Average Shoulder/Tail
Annotation: The average ratio between prominence of shoulder and tail in a kernel density distribution

Name: FFT Ratio
Annotation: Ratio between second and first peak position in Fast Fourier Transformation

Name: Average Rise Time
Annotation: Average rise time

Name: Average Decay Time
Annotation: Average duration of decreasing waveform, from peak point to the first point lower than valley value plus variance (10% of max)

Name: Peak To End
Annotation: Average of duration between peak and next starting point

Name: Number of Peaks
Annotation: Number of peaks

Name: Peak Frequency
Annotation: Number of period for the 100 seconds, 100/Peak Space

Name: Maximum Amplitude
Annotation: The highest amplitude

Name: Maximum Intensity
Annotation: The highest signal in the waveform

Name: Average Peak Amplitude
Annotation: Average peak amplitude

Name: Average Intensity
Annotation: The average intensity (highest signal in a period)

Name: RMS
Annotation: Root mean square of peak amplitudes

Name: Average Peak Space
Annotation: The average duration of period

Name: Average Inner Peak Space
Annotation: The average duration of periods removing outliers

Name: Average Tail Duration
Annotation: The average duration of tail

Name: Average Valley
Annotation: The average intensity of valley points

Name: Average Shoulder Position
Annotation: The average relative position of shoulder in a period (0-1)

Name: Multi-Peaks
Annotation: Maximum of the number of peaks in one period

Name: PW10
Annotation: The average of peak width at 10% from peak to bottom.

Name: PW25
Annotation: The average of peak width at 25% from peak to bottom

Name: PW50
Annotation: The average of peak width at 50% from peak to bottom

Name: PW80
Annotation: The average of peak width at 80% from peak to bottom

Name: PW90
Annotation: The average of peak width at 90% from peak to bottom

Name: Average Shoulder Amplitude
Annotation: The average of amplitude of shoulder

Name: Minimum Intensity
Annotation: The minimum signal of the waveform, should be 0 if scaled
